main event: A brilliant light with an independent glow in the form of a ball, approximately 15-20 feet in diameter, was observed near Buena Vista, Colorado on October 28, 1951.
interesting points: The witness was a rated pilot of the U.S. Air Defense Command, and his report was described as 'simple, direct and convincing as to details'.
The light moved with no sound and disappeared in a descending vertical glide.
On October 20, 1951, a strange cigar-shaped object with a bluish haze was observed crossing the terrain from east to west at a very high rate of speed.
The object stayed within the witness's sight for approximately 20 seconds and appeared to change color as the temperature of the particles changed.
The incident was categorized as an example of the 'green fireball phenomena', with no conclusions drawn.
sighted object: a brilliant light with an independent glow in the form of a ball, and a cigar-shaped object with a bluish haze
witnesses: a rated pilot of the U.S. Air Defense Command
